plain: The user's favourite genre is likely to be young adult fiction, as both "The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants" and "The Catcher in the Rye" fall into this category. The user's favourite kind of plot is likely to be character-driven, as both "How to Be Good" and "Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close" focus on the development of their protagonists. The user's favourite setting is likely to be contemporary, as all of the books are set in the modern world. The user's favourite writing style is likely to be accessible and engaging, as all of the books are written in a way that is easy to read and keeps the reader interested. The user's favourite length is likely to be novel-length, as all of the books are full-length novels. The user's favourite topic is likely to be coming-of-age, as all of the books deal with the themes of growing up and self-discovery. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be steady and consistent, as all of the books have a good flow to them. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be third-person omniscient, as all of the books are told from a neutral perspective that allows the reader to see all of the characters' thoughts and actions. The user's favourite themes are likely to be family, friendship, and self-discovery.
